Source: j2a.js

const {Value, Word, Apply} = require("./ast.js");

// From JSON to AST map
let j2a = Object.create(null);
j2a['value'] = (j) => new Value(j);
j2a['word']  = (j) => new Word(j);
j2a['apply'] = (j) => new Apply(j);


/**
 * Generic JSON traversing building the AST with Egg specific classes.
 * @param {Object} node JSON that represents a node of an AST. 
 * @returns The equivalent class object tree to the input.
 */
function json2AST(node) { 
  if (node.type == 'apply') {
    return new Apply({
      type: 'apply',
      operator: json2AST(node.operator),
      args: node.args.map(tree => json2AST(tree))
    });
  }

  return j2a[node.type](node);
}

module.exports = { json2AST };
